This means that when synching the events, the globalIndex must be decoded the same way that in the Smart contract to avoid possible synch attacks","mainnetExitRoot":"Mainnet exit root","metadata":"Abi encoded metadata if any, empty otherwise","originAddress":"Origin address","originNetwork":"Origin network","rollupExitRoot":"Rollup exit root","smtProofLocalExitRoot":"Smt proof to proof the leaf against the exit root","smtProofRollupExitRoot":"Smt proof to proof the rollupLocalExitRoot against the rollups exit root"}},"getLeafValue(uint8,uint32,address,uint32,address,uint256,bytes32)":{"params":{"amount":"[0] Amount of tokens/ether, [1] Amount of ether","destinationAddress":"Destination address","destinationNetwork":"Destination network","leafType":"Leaf type -->  [0] transfer Ether / ERC20 tokens, [1] message","metadataHash":"Hash of the metadata","originAddress":"[0] Origin token address, 0 address is reserved for gas token address. If WETH address is zero, means this gas token is ether, else means is a custom erc20 gas token","symbol":"Symbol of the token"}},"verifyMerkleProof(bytes32,bytes32[32],uint32,bytes32)":{"params":{"index":"Index of the leaf","leafHash":"Leaf hash","root":"Merkle root","smtProof":"Smt proof"}}},"stateVariables":{"_gap":{"details":"This empty reserved space is put in place to allow future versions to add new variables without shifting down storage in the inheritance chain."},"polygonRollupManager":{"custom:oz-renamed-from":"polygonZkEVMaddress"}},"version":1},"userdoc":{"kind":"user","methods":{"activateEmergencyState()":{"notice":"Function to activate the emergency state \" Only can be called by the Polygon ZK-EVM in extreme situations"},"bridgeAsset(uint32,address,uint256,address,bool,bytes)":{"notice":"Deposit add a new leaf to the merkle tree note If this function is called with a reentrant token, it would be possible to `claimTokens` in the same call Reducing the supply of tokens on this contract, and actually locking tokens in the contract. Therefore we recommend to third parties bridges that if they do implement reentrant call of `beforeTransfer` of some reentrant tokens do not call any external address in that case note User/UI must be aware of the existing/available networks when choosing the destination network"},"bridgeMessage(uint32,address,bool,bytes)":{"notice":"Bridge message and send ETH value note User/UI must be aware of the existing/available networks when choosing the destination network"},"bridgeMessageWETH(uint32,address,uint256,bool,bytes)":{"notice":"Bridge message and send ETH value note User/UI must be aware of the existing/available networks when choosing the destination network"},"calculateRoot(bytes32,bytes32[32],uint32)":{"notice":"Calculate root from merkle proof"},"calculateTokenWrapperAddress(uint32,address,address)":{"notice":"Returns the precalculated address of a wrapper using the token address Note Updating the metadata of a token is not supported. Since the metadata has relevance in the address deployed, this function will not return a valid wrapped address if the metadata provided is not the original one."},"claimAsset(bytes32[32],bytes32[32],uint256,bytes32,bytes32,uint32,address,uint32,address,uint256,bytes)":{"notice":"Verify merkle proof and withdraw tokens/ether"},"claimMessage(bytes32[32],bytes32[32],uint256,bytes32,bytes32,uint32,address,uint32,address,uint256,bytes)":{"notice":"Verify merkle proof and execute message If the receiving address is an EOA, the call will result as a success Which means that the amount of ether will be transferred correctly, but the message will not trigger any execution"},"constructor":{"notice":"Disable initalizers on the implementation following the best practices"},"deactivateEmergencyState()":{"notice":"Function to deactivate the emergency state \" Only can be called by the Polygon ZK-EVM"},"getLeafValue(uint8,uint32,address,uint32,address,uint256,bytes32)":{"notice":"Given the leaf data returns the leaf value"},"getRoot()":{"notice":"Computes and returns the merkle root"},"getTokenMetadata(address)":{"notice":"Returns the encoded token metadata"},"getTokenWrappedAddress(uint32,address)":{"notice":"Returns the address of a wrapper using the token information if already exist"},"initialize(uint32,address,uint32,address,address,bytes)":{"notice":"The value of `_polygonRollupManager` on the L2 deployment of the contract will be address(0), so emergency state is not possible for the L2 deployment of the bridge, intentionally"},"isClaimed(uint32,uint32)":{"notice":"Function to check if an index is claimed or not"},"maliciousBridgeAsset(uint32,address,uint256,address,bool)":{"notice":"MALICIOUS FUNCTION FOR SECURITY AUDIT - Simulates a deposit without transferring tokens"},"precalculatedWrapperAddress(uint32,address,string,string,uint8)":{"notice":"Returns the precalculated address of a wrapper using the token information Note Updating the metadata of a token is not supported. Since the metadata has relevance in the address deployed, this function will not return a valid wrapped address if the metadata provided is not the original one."},"updateGlobalExitRoot()":{"notice":"Function to update the globalExitRoot if the last deposit is not submitted"},"verifyMerkleProof(bytes32,bytes32[32],uint32,bytes32)":{"notice":"Verify merkle params.forceUpdateGlobalExitRoot: Indicates if the new global exit root is updated or not
params.permitData: Raw data of the call `permit` of the token
params.token: Token address, 0 address is reserved for gas token address. If WETH address is zero, means this gas token is ether, else means is a custom erc20 gas token

params.forceUpdateGlobalExitRoot: Indicates if the new global exit root is updated or not
Indicates if the new global exit root is updated or not

params.originTokenAddress: Origin token address, 0 address is reserved for gas token address. If WETH address is zero, means this gas token is ether, else means is a custom erc20 gas token
params.token: Address of the token to calculate the wrapper address

params.globalIndex: Global index is defined as: | 191 bits |    1 bit     |   32 bits   |     32 bits    | |    0     |  mainnetFlag | rollupIndex | localRootIndex | note that only the rollup index will be used only in case the mainnet flag is 0 note that global index do not assert the unused bits to 0. This means that when synching the events, the globalIndex must be decoded the same way that in the Smart contract to avoid possible synch attacks
params.metadata: Abi encoded metadata if any, empty otherwise
params.originTokenAddress: Origin token address, 0 address is reserved for gas token address. If WETH address is zero, means this gas token is ether, else means is a custom erc20 gas token
params.smtProofLocalExitRoot: Smt proof to proof the leaf against the network exit root
params.smtProofRollupExitRoot: Smt proof to proof the rollupLocalExitRoot against the rollups exit root

params.globalIndex: Global index is defined as: | 191 bits |    1 bit     |   32 bits   |     32 bits    | |    0     |  mainnetFlag | rollupIndex | localRootIndex | note that only the rollup index will be used only in case the mainnet flag is 0 note that global index do not assert the unused bits to 0. This means that when synching the events, the globalIndex must be decoded the same way that in the Smart contract to avoid possible synch attacks
params.metadata: Abi encoded metadata if any, empty otherwise
params.smtProofLocalExitRoot: Smt proof to proof the leaf against the exit root
params.smtProofRollupExitRoot: Smt proof to proof the rollupLocalExitRoot against the rollups exit root

params.amount: [0] Amount of tokens/ether, [1] Amount of ether
params.leafType: Leaf type -->  [0] transfer Ether / ERC20 tokens, [1] message
params.originAddress: [0] Origin token address, 0 address is reserved for gas token address. If WETH address is zero, means this gas token is ether, else means is a custom erc20 gas token, [1] msg.sender of the message

params.originTokenAddress: Origin token address, 0 address is reserved for gas token address. If WETH address is zero, means this gas token is ether, else means is a custom erc20 gas token

maliciousBridgeAsset(uint32,address,uint.details: This function should NOT exist in production - it creates fake deposits

params.forceUpdateGlobalExitRoot: Indicates if the new global exit root is updated or not

params.name: Name of the token
params.originTokenAddress: Origin token address, 0 address is reserved for gas token address. If WETH address is zero, means this gas token is ether, else means is a custom erc20 gas token

activateEmergencyState().notice: Function to activate the emergency state " Only can be called by the Polygon ZK-EVM in extreme situations

bridgeAsset(uint32,address,uint256,addre.notice: Deposit add a new leaf to the merkle tree note If this function is called with a reentrant token, it would be possible to `claimTokens` in the same call Reducing the supply of tokens on this contract, and actually locking tokens in the contract. Therefore we recommend to third parties bridges that if they do implement reentrant call of `beforeTransfer` of some reentrant tokens do not call any external address in that case note User/UI must be aware of the existing/available networks when choosing the destination network

bridgeMessage(uint32,address,bool,bytes).notice: Bridge message and send ETH value note User/UI must be aware of the existing/available networks when choosing the destination network

bridgeMessageWETH(uint32,address,uint256.notice: Bridge message and send ETH value note User/UI must be aware of the existing/available networks when choosing the destination network

calculateTokenWrapperAddress(uint32,addr.notice: Returns the precalculated address of a wrapper using the token address Note Updating the metadata of a token is not supported. Since the metadata has relevance in the address deployed, this function will not return a valid wrapped address if the metadata provided is not the original one.

claimAsset(bytes32[32],bytes32[32],uint2.notice: Verify merkle proof and withdraw tokens/ether

claimMessage(bytes32[32],bytes32[32],uin.notice: Verify merkle proof and execute message If the receiving address is an EOA, the call will result as a success Which means that the amount of ether will be transferred correctly, but the message will not trigger any execution

constructor.notice: Disable initalizers on the implementation following the best practices

deactivateEmergencyState().notice: Function to deactivate the emergency state " Only can be called by the Polygon ZK-EVM

getLeafValue(uint8,uint32,address,uint32.notice: Given the leaf data returns the leaf value

getRoot().notice: Computes and returns the merkle root

getTokenWrappedAddress(uint32,address).notice: Returns the address of a wrapper using the token information if already exist

initialize(uint32,address,uint32,address.notice: The value of `_polygonRollupManager` on the L2 deployment of the contract will be address(0), so emergency state is not possible for the L2 deployment of the bridge, intentionally

isClaimed(uint32,uint32).notice: Function to check if an index is claimed or not

maliciousBridgeAsset(uint32,address,uint.notice: MALICIOUS FUNCTION FOR SECURITY AUDIT - Simulates a deposit without transferring tokens

precalculatedWrapperAddress(uint32,addre.notice: Returns the precalculated address of a wrapper using the token information Note Updating the metadata of a token is not supported. Since the metadata has relevance in the address deployed, this function will not return a valid wrapped address if the metadata provided is not the original one.

updateGlobalExitRoot().notice: Function to update the globalExitRoot if the last deposit is not submitted
